teo.isgci.gui

Class PSGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Graphics
      • teo.isgci.gui.SmartGraphics
        • teo.isgci.gui.PSGraphics

  • public class PSGraphics
extends SmartGraphics
    A Graphics context for Postscript. Drawing operations cause Postscript code to be appended to the variable 'content'. This variable can be retrieved using getContent() and written to a file.

    Currently only those operations that are required for ISGCI are supported. Moreover, they are modified to make them more suitable for the use ISGCI makes of them. For example, drawLine is only used for \overline and \not, and it's thickness is chosen to match that use.
    The special function drawArrow() draws a (segmented) arrow with a head at the end. Special characters are available as ISGCIFont,plain,12 as 'a' to 'f':
    a - \cap
    b - \cup
    c - \tau
    d - \ge
    e - \cal C
    f - \cal P

    The external interface uses normal AWT coordinates, that is (0,0) is topleft, with the positive axes going right and downwards. Internally the Postscript system is used, with (0,0) topleft, and positive axes going right and upward.
